Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mrsljones2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights very recently, the hotel has modern orange themed decor. We had a good sized corner room which was great, the only downside was the noise but we found that only a little disturbing. The Vatican is very close by and we managed to walk to all the sights in Rome quite easily from the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a good stay for what we paid!

Reviews.Title: “very cute hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: gauravbatra
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights from 14th december ' 11 till the 17th... we had a lovely stay in the beautiful city of rome... its a lovely hotel with super staff... the staff helped us in every way possible with the maps, ways and every other need... location is excellent just 5 mins walk from the vatican city and metro station. rooms were ok size but very cozy and comfortable. we loved the breakfast arrangement on the terrace with a few options but excellent coffee... i would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a comfortable stay in the city... also when in rome if u you plan to take a tourist open bus... make sure you check ..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaniceFen87
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be undergoing some refurbishments, so I must tell that I was shocked on arrival thinking it was a scam, until I realized there was a provisional entrance on the side. After this shock, I was very pleased with the outcome of our stay. The hotel is clean and well kept. Our room was of appropriate size. I would have liked better lightning since the rooms are rather dark, and some shampoo and conditioner considering it is a four star hotel. Apart from this I found the room very comfortable. The staff was very helpful even before arrival when I sent some queries. Check in and check out were easily processed. They also arranged for out transportation back to the airport and though we were told to wait for four minutes, after a minute the taxi arrived. The breakfast though not extensive was good. Hotel is also very close to the metro and there are a number of shops close by, much cheaper then the ones found in the center. A drawback was however Internet access. It cost euro 5 for the whole stay but we only got to know on our last day, and I found it rather disappointing that it is not offered free of charge at least in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: colekinney
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. Staff were kind and attentive. Local restaurants were overpriced and the food was so so.. It's close to a metro station and was easy to get around

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Dunrite
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel which was apparently being refurbished during our stay so some of the facilities were not available. Overall the location is great, the staff were very helpful, but thats where it stopped. The lift was from the roaring twenties. For a 4* price they didn't provide any shampoo and conditioner with 2 star being quite generous. despite the fact it seems to have had a facelift in some areas the hotel still looks tired

Reviews.Title: “Great first stop on European Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Allison M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite here the first 3 nights of our European Honeymoon. The location was OUTSTANDING, and the suite was very nice also. The first day our sleep was off so we woke up at 10pm and roamed the streets of Rome until 3am. One of our favorite memories is walking to the Vatican that night while no one was there. We had dinner, visited the Vatican, and sipped wine on the street until 3 am. We never once felt threatened or unsafe. I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay in a great location. The restaurants nearby offer a delicious menu and true Roman food. Each night we slept with the windows open and listened to the hustle and bustle of the city life. To some this may not sound appealing, but to us it was a nice difference from what we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “spoilt by the last hour”
Reviews.Author: rebecca b
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be lovely and clean. Nice bathroom (no soap) and breakfast. However the resteraunt and bar were closed which we were not informed of at check-in. And there is no tea or coffee in the room. Very close to the vatican and St Peter's with plenty of nice places to eat around it. Our break however came to a bad end in trying to order a taxi. We had asked the previous night if we could book one and was told by the receptionist that she would ring in the morning and it would be here in 5 minutes - this lady had been very helpful all weekend. In the morning when we asked the lady who checked us out - I think it may have been the owner or manager as we hadn't seen her before told us there was a taxi strike that day so we couldn't travel that way. After very little help in trying to arrange transport (she didn't want to help) We dashed to the airport via metro and bus and luckily arrived with only 5 minutes to spare. A great little hotel just check any information given is correct.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Adam_obrien
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here at the end of October. The location is perfect, 10 min walk into the centre and a 5 min walk to The Vatican. We stayed for 3 nights and loved the hotel and the city. The hotel is clean and i loved the design! The breakfast was simple but still very good. The staff were ace and the women at the front desk was very helpful and polite. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Yes a little noisy from the road but after spending every day walking around the city this will not bother you! We got engaged in Rome and this hotel added to the experience. We both plan to come back to Rome very soon and will be using the Orange hotel again! Thanks for a great stay and making a very special time even more special!! Thanks Adam and Keleigh xx

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: martinamcloughlin
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because I'd been bumped from the nearby Hotel dei Consoli. Terrible entrance and very unappealing building. The room was rather small, chilly, noisy and there were no blackout blinds. The bed wasn't very comfortable as well as not having a blanket and there was only one throw available. The pervading lurid orange plastic was rather an eyesore - don't know how all that plastic fits in with the eco theme. Breakfast was mediocre - (more) plastic ham and cheese with some cakes. The mandarins were well past their sell by date. Rather dodgy way of serving orange juice too from bottles stored in a not so clean cooler. No sign of a waitress and no offers of coffee though got an espresso on request. The stuff in the flasks is undrinkable. Tables were not clean. The receptionists were pleasant but not at all helpful to another guest who had problems with his TV. Very expensive very wi-fi. Miserable selection of TV channels and nothing in English. Not even all the usual Rai, Mediaset channels etc were available! Don't know where they got 4 stars from. Only reason to stay here is the location close to the \Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull location, ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellAround8
Reviews.Content: Again in Rome for business. Again my favourite hotel full booked, and so chasing for an alternative. Orange hotel wants to appear as a design hotel, but it's misleading... common and banal design and furnitures. very dark room and very noisy! and the continuous ripetition of this orange colour everywhere disgusts. The entrance is hidden, and the front face of building is a failure shop with blank windows. My last bad remember is the price and breakfast: more than 160€/n bkft incl, and a poor bfast with industrial croissant and sour orange juice. Nevertheless....the location is amazing! S.Peter 2min walking! no more back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: Jami360
Reviews.Content: We traveled all over Italy and this was our least favorite hotel. The area was just o.k. but our room left much to be desired. First, it had a smell to it, like a light locker room smell. Secondly, the lighting in the rooms are NOT good for middle aged people at all. They have an orange glow to them and you can't see well. The shower has no shelves at all to put your soap/shampoo. We asked the front desk for a suggestion for dinner and it was our worse meal on our trip. The staff was not helpful to their guest, you were basically left on your own. Breakfast was o.k. The elevator is terrible. I would suggest somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not close to the centre of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: 370angelo
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website is not the reality!Very small rooms with a so small bathroom.Noisy at night and finally it was really expensive!

Reviews.Title: “"WOW"”
Reviews.Author: claire r
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orange for 3 nights, the room was great Fabulous bed, you can hear traffic from the road but it is not as noisy as other guests have commented, we slept soundly - the room also had air con, the bathroom was spotlessly clean with fresh fluffy towels when needed and the hairdryer had enough power more than my usual travel one. The views from the terrace during breakfast were stunning - sitting in the sun looking at St Peters Bascilica, the location is fantastic with the Vatican being a 5 min walk away, and there is a wonderful restaurant on the opposite corner the meals there were beautiful and not expensive. The Orange staff were all kind and friendly and we were able to leave our case there on our last day so as to enjoy Rome one last time without trailing our luggage about - Great! We will definately be making a return trip and have recommended the hotel already - you'll be having my brother to stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoe s
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel for 4 nights when we arrived lift not working and no one to help with our luggage not a good start.photos of hotel look much better than actually is .it needs re decorating and lighting is very dingy.we had a triple room that was made up of a double bed and what i can only describe as a plastic table what they had tried to pass as a bed it was very uncomfortable.the breakfast was horrible not much choice and a waste of time really.location great and restaurant on corner across road superb.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JKalionis
Reviews.Content: A really wonderful place to stay. Fabulous location, quiet, clean and very well appointed rooms. A wonderful eco-driven ethos that underpins everything done there. Lovely, lovely meals on the rooftop and the BEST martini ever. Can't wait to go back and visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jean L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lemon suite in the Orange hotel, during the 19th to the 23rd of September. The room was fantastic, it was spotlessly clean and it was a huge room. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast but a very high standard. The location of the orange hotel was amazing. We only had two problems. One was the noise of the road which is extremely loud. I live in a city and I am use to road noise but Via Crescenzio is a very busy road, though the hotel do provide ear plugs. The other problem we had was that the air conditioning in our room broke, it took a full day in order to fix the air conditioning, and the room smelt like stagnant water for that day, the repair man also made a phone call from our phone in the room which result in us getting charged for it. (The receptionist kindly took it off very quickly). Overall the orange hotel was a great hotel and I would recommend it to anybody in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “It's NOT a Hotel it is a Youth Hostel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pillango82
Reviews.Content: First of all it's NOT a Hotel it is a Youth Hostel!!!!!! We stayed 2 nights in there and we had the worst experience! The staff members are rude , not helpful at all, they make you feel you interrupted them all the time! So after check in we walked in to our room which was a size of a bed, couldn't even walk around the bed, ( which we booked a queen size bed, and given us 2 single bed pussed together) so we tried to closed the door behind us but we couldn't because our suitcases didn't fit into a room! So I went down to reception and tell them about the situation, but the only think the sad you book this room so deal with that! So we had to open one of the suitcase in the bathroom and the other one in the window!! The breakfast is very poor and don't even have frees fruits... The second day we went to reception to ask then to book a restaurant for us but no one was at reception so I fined her in outside in the smoking area smoking, of course she was keep smoking when she was talking to us and made us to feel we are disrupting her little time! So if you wanna stay in Rome for a few night in a good area and new hotel with a good price I can recommend Una Hotel next to Termini station! Do not make a mistake to staying at the Orange Hostel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price especially if you will be out and about in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie K
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for one night in the junior suite. It met our needs and the price was right (special rate for US travelers) but did not "wow" us. The location is good because it is close to the Vatican and the Metro. The private parking was a plus but make sure your car is tiny because it is a VERY tight fit. The bed was a bit hard and yes, the traffic is noisy (as city dwellers we were right at home) but being so exhausted after sight seeing is wasn't a problem. The air conditioner cooled the room but when we left it on while sight seeing it turned itself off and we had to have the front desk reset it. We left very early in the morning so we did not get a chance to try the breakfast but we did get a drink at the rooftop cafe and the service was very slow because they only had one girl serving. The staff was pleasant and they let us go up to the private hot tub terrace to take pictures of the city scape. All in all, it's a good choice for the price range, just don't expect a luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. And mrs. T”
Reviews.Author: Samantha T
Reviews.Content: I had taken my husband to Rome as a gift for his 40th birthday but unfortunately the moment was lost due to poor organisation by the hotel. As soon as we checked in and gave our names they told us there was a problem; they lied by telling us there was no electric on the forth floor so they have arranged another hotel for us to stay in that night. When we returned the next morning, we were told our room was not ready and it was not on the fourth floor ( they double booked our room the previous day and no electrical fault!). With the fuss of the night before and the morning we had missed half a day of our time. the hotel is in a perfect location of Rome, but was grubby in places. We were also expecting a bath and bath robes, we had none of these. The room was very small, noisy with very poor lighting. No room service and the rooftop restaurant closed to early; popped up for coffee at 10pm but was already closing. The continental breakfast was fantastic and the staff member who helped with the breakfast was excellent. Every body should visit Rome at least once in their lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sjrRaleigh
Reviews.Content: The Orange hotel is perfectly located between the Vatican and the main city attractions with just a short walk to most areas. I also found the hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. I will return next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome and Hotel was good”
Reviews.Author: joanna P
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally placed for the Vatican and only a short walk to the other attractions. We had heard that alot of places close down in Rome for August and certainly there were a few restaurants that didn't open but it was still incredibly vibrant and busy! We were given one of the rooms on the side of the hotel so we had no issue with the noise as mentioned by others.However the room was really small with barely room to walk around the bed. The bathroom was a shower only. No problem but again very small. I did consider asking to move to a larger room but the hotel was full and to be fair the room was clean comfortable and quiet! I'm not normally into continental breakfast but the pastries were really fresh and lovely and the coffee was good. The restaurant is on the roof and it was lovely being able to look out over the rooftops and actually see the Vatican! I would consider going back to the same hotel. Bigger room next time please. We ate at several different places but our favourite was MACANDO's one street over from the piazza Navona in via Tor Millina 23. We had a lovely long lunch there and enjoyed it so much we went back for dinner. If you find it then ask for Joanna. Tell her Joanna from Plymouth says Hi!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Vatican, but noisey and average appearance!"”
Reviews.Author: VikingDNA
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 19-22, 2011. The hotel appearance is unimpressive but very close to Vatican City which is why we chose it. Staff provided marginal service as they failed to explain how to use the room lights and TV, a bit trickey. Night clerk also declined to assisting us with a transportation dilemma. Mini-suite was a good size but it faced the noisy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very unique”
Reviews.Author: IanRoss82
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Orange Hotel. Great value at $100 a night for a nice, modern room. Plus the rooftop patio, restaurant and hot tub were big pluses. Very close to the Vatican and enough little restaurants and cafes in the area in the evening. Staying near the Spanish Steps would have been better... but at least four times the price for a similar place, so very happy with our choice. Subway was close by when we needed it on a few occasions. Staff were polite, but not very overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choise for Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoanaOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this hotel and liked very much. For Rome is a hotel modern and affordable, I was pleased with this choice becouse as a rule in Rome the cheap is old. I booked in August 2010 and able to pay 300 € all taxes included for 4 nights, in July 2011. Very good. I was in a room on the 1st floor, the Mandarin. They are small but very comfortable. I just think it could have more light ... The free channels are not very good, but with only turned on the television before bedtime, did not make much difference. The bathroom is good and had a bath with bath. In summer breakfast is served on the terrace, which has a beautiful view and becomes very enjoyable. Really loved the food, although I think there should be fruit ... the croassaints were great, and also capuccionos. The team was very friendly and helpful. the location is good and has a bus that goes to the center at the door of the hotel, and also very close to subway, the square in front there are plenty of restaurants. Thers one, the Pizza Paradiso, that have mix of pizza and drink for 7€. We liked a lot the Orange Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: janemcg44
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the staff very friendly. The only problem we had with the hotel was we didnt get any sleep the 4 nights we stayed as it was very noisy outside you could here the traffic all night.

Reviews.Title: “i love u rome!”
Reviews.Author: alelove3
Reviews.Content: the hotel is orange!!!! eheheheh....and is possible to say that is very original hotel. The room was very cute and clean, with all things that u need , air condition/cable tv etc etc.... Near by the vatican, 5 min. by walk.....so u are in the heart of rome, from the hotel by walk or by bike u can travel around the city without problem. The frontdesk is very kindly and also all people that working there are so young (me too)!! Fantastic make a breakfast in the roof where u can see all, and also u can find there a idromassage!!!!!!! They tall me that u can eat well also at dinner time, but i think that u can find a good food everywhere in rome just 1 bed news: all the room have a window along the road, so is not easy sleep well :( A good trip in rome! Alex

Reviews.Title: “Funky, definitely different - definitely good!”
Reviews.Author: janniebabemerseyside
Reviews.Content: We've previously stayed in Rome further up by the Cornelia Metro Link and had to travel into Rome to visit the sights. So Glad I booked this hotel - very different in style to what we've stayed in before. Staff very pleasant and helpful - not as some people have said in some reviews I've read - I do wonder what some people expect. Treat the staff nicely and they will help in whatever way they can. Breakfast very simple but more than enough to set you up for the day - the usual cheese, ham and pastries but all very nice and fresh. Dining/bar area is on the 4th floor roof terrace - only views of rooftops and the Basilica Dome but very relaxing. Room very comfortable and they provided earplugs possibly because of sirens or traffic noise but we had no problem with that as after all the walking we were too tired to notice any noise and possibly the padded walls in the rooms also stopped the noise. We were pleasantly surprised at how close the hotel was to the attractions. Hotel very near to Vatican (300 mtrs) a short walk brought you to the Castel Sant Angelo and the river Tiber. A commentated river cruise costs about €15 but this is a 24hr ticket and you can hop on and off the boat at its landing stages. Also go into the Castel it costs €7 but is well worth it for the views. The Vatican is free to enter although you can pay to walk up the 400+ steps to the roof and walk around there - its too hot up there! Wednesday is the day to go if you want to hear the pope do his weekly prayer thing but probably too many bodies around for that. Places to go for ice cream best by far is the Old Bridge gelataria by the Vatican Museum - huge scoops for a minimal price. For good coffee and sandwiches visit Castroni's on Via Ottaviano they also sell a fantastic range of foods and wines, sweets and their own blend of coffee specially ground for you. For an evening meal try Sorpasso in Via Properzio (very near to the hotel) the staff are very friendly and the menu is fantastic - prices again are very reasonable (€4 for a glass of good organic wine) nice tapas served to you as well. A fantastic city to visit but beware of scams and pickpockets - one scam is a driver pulls up on the sidewalk asking directions (in our case - the sistine chapel) he will be very friendly and strike up a conversation telling you he works for Armani and shows a catalogue and because you've been friendly he will offer a gift - we declined as we knew the scam but what normally happens is he will then ask for some money for petrol as he will probably run out of fuel and then he will turn nasty. Just walk away! Other than that go to the Orange Hotel in Rome and enjoy yourself x

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: JWJL2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, as we are looking for possible hotels for a wedding party in Rome next May.. The hotel itself is great, the rooms were perfect, and the location is more than ideal. The noise did not both us as after walking all day, we were fast asleep. Room was cleaned everyday and towels replaced.. Breakfast was okay.. The usual, cereal, yoghurts & pastries.. The only downside was on the last day we fancied using the "solarium & jacuzzi" as we went through the roof terrace, we was met by a male worker of the terrace who asked if we was "ordering" as we said "no, going upstairs to the Solarium" He told is that we have to pay for this service and we should go to reception... Nowhere was it stated we had to pay to use the faculties therefore felt this was a let down...and should have been made cleared this is a service you have to pay for... All in all however, would still recommend this hotel and it's on the list for next year when we return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamesrossm
Reviews.Content: I couldn't tell the staff from the guests. The room wasn't too bad but it hadn't been opened for weeks, or so it smelled. Staff are friendly enough but useless. A request for assistance with vatican tickets was met with it's best you do it yourself. 4 staff watched as we struggled with our luggage when we entered, although I suppose they may have been guests, but they were sitting behind the desk. TV didn't work. No brochures or anything about the hotel, when breakfast is, what services they provide, or anything to actually help you enjoy yourself. This is a notch above a hostel, masquerading as a "design" hotel. The location is only good if you plan going to the Vatican everyday. I can't explain why anyone could rate this as a good hotel. Nothing about it is good at all. There was a pair of underpants on the roof top deck near the jacuzzi and an empty bottle of beer which stayed there for at least 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, expected a better standard”
Reviews.Author: Anne_K_1978
Reviews.Content: We expcted a four star hotel, but soon realised the standard was much lower than it ought to be. The photos on their website definitely lie, and it does not deserve more than three stars. Our room was noisy, dirty and smelled like urine.

Reviews.Title: “Greeat staff & Location - Poor facilties”
Reviews.Author: MrsS1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with my parents to Rome for a long weekend. We chose this hotel due to it's location. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Vatican and St Marks Sq. All other sights are within walking distance. The staff were all very helpful and offered advice on resturants to eat in the evening and places to visit. Breakfast was ok, they offered tea, coffee and a continental breakfast offering pastries, cold meats and cheese, with toasts and yoghurts. The rooms are small and quite dark due to the decoration in the rooms. Both our room and my parents smelt of stale water and the bathrooms were not as expected. The whirlpool baths look great but after my parents using theirs on the first night and it leaving a grey sludge film around the bath (whilst my father was in it....he is not that dirty!!) the filters were obviously not run through and cleaned properly. The water was never hot, in the three days I never had a hot bath or shower - this was the same for my parents. The road is very noisy and the windows are not built to block this noise out, I would have expected double glazing in the centre of Rome - unfortunately this was not the case. In all the staff and location were fabulous and I praise them highly, however I would not recommend this hotel as a comfortable nights stay and I would suggest this is more of a 3* that a 4* as it states.

Reviews.Title: “Dreams come true!”
Reviews.Author: EvaKiev_Ukraine
Reviews.Content: I had flight to city of my dream - Roma, bcz I admire of Italian Renaissance (art, painting) and actually 80% of riches of world culture are there. Oh yes, I was impressed. I stayed at Orange Hotel near Vatican and would like to thank personnel of hotel for their service. Hotel is very cute, has a designer interior and open gallery, clean and very nice location. Have a perfect vacation, dear travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, funky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: najj61
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Rome so didn't know what to expect. Hotel was very contemporary, the staff were very friendly and accommodating; food in the rooftop restaurant was good and it was nice to sit out at night for our evening meal and for breakfast in the morning. The locals thought it a bit chilly but to us it was like summer! The hotel was just around the corner from the Vatican and only 20 minutes walk from everything else, depending on which route you took. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 days and would definitely stay there again. The only downside was lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room but that made us get out and about and spend less time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, friendly high quality hotel, great location, excellent roomservice.”
Reviews.Author: CarinaFaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in february in what i think must have been a junior suite. We were very happy when we arrived in our room to see that it was clean, comfy and very cool & fresh design. Nice spacious bathroom & a tub. Staff was really friendy and serviceminded. They serve a really nice brealfast buffet in the restaurant on the roof. Lovely service in the restaurant also, it's recommended for breakfast AND for dinner. I will definately recommend this hotel, it's also very close to the Metro. Taxi stops right around the corner. You can actually walk pretty much wherever you want too from here also if your up for it, and i recommend you too because there is alot to see! We'll be back one time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benemich75
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights whilst attending a conference. It's a modern hotel with well appointed rooms in a contemporary style. In fact everything about the hotel is clean and modern and ORANGE and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The restaurant has very nice choice of meat the terrace is very friendly atmosphere and is a lovely place to unwind. Breakfast is up there with the best of them. The hotel very well situated and only a 5 - 10 minute walk from the Vaticane entrance. Prices are perhaps toward the top end of the budget, but you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel very close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: EddieDaBass
Reviews.Content: Orange hotel is a very nice hotel. Trendy, clean and right where it should be! We could walk just about anywhere. Most people would probably head to the Metro which was 3 minutes to walk from the hotel, but we used our legs and walked around, to the spanish steps, shopping street and so on. The staff is very welcoming. Clean & very nice room with a big comfy bed! Our room also had a bathtub in the middle of the room, + a really nice shower & toilet. You will hear the street outside, but the hotel gives you complementary earplugs so you probably won't notice. On the top floor there is a restaurant with really good food. The staff in the restaurant is also super, they treated us like family. We will probably book the same hotel if we visit Rome again, so it's recommended for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ponkey12321
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orange was in the best location. Just a second around the corner from the Vatican City. The staff were ok but the room made it all better. Orange highlights around the place. Rooms were small but would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and modern style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mini04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and we loved it! Great staff, rooftop breakfast every morning, and its walking distance to St Peters/Vatican museum. Oh and there's a good vinoteca on the south east corner. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “dont get late to the beakfast u ll be mistreat”
Reviews.Author: eduardomiyake
Reviews.Content: I rent throu lateroom as Magno Hotel , so it was very difucult to find out the place during the night because there is no sigth as magno Hotel , but as Orange Hotel . The breakfast is in a restaurant on upstair that doesn´t belong to the hotel , it is outsourcered , in the first day me and a my wife went 10 min before the breakfast end , the waiter called Cida , made a explict ugly face , even so we made the breakfast , but after 5 min I ordered aotoher coffe and she said that they are closed even the cofe is rigth on front of me . The other guest next to me got scared with so agressivit , we too . It was very disappointment for me and my wife , we will never go back to there . Worst we went the next day on time but the coffee was not done yet , it is a paradox . The recepcionist was cool we quit to stay the 3 nigths due to the waiter

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: BruceEper
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small as are most European rooms and the bathrooms are small as well but we found the staff helpfull and the location is excellent and the amenties quite OK. we would go back

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra088
Reviews.Content: It is not a four star hotel, it is barely two if any. I have never stayed in a place where people where so unresponsive to customer's needs. Management did not see that despite not having working AC, we were comfortable. We checked in and nobody bother to tell us how things work in the room, the staff in their restaurant smokes first and then ask you what you need, I did not see them washing their hands in between handling food and smoking in front of us. The third day of no AC, the manager went to our room and left the window open and said the AC was working.The door did not close unless you forcefully do it and stay in front of it for a couple of minutes to ensure it was closed. It is funny the stare and look that the front desk gives you when you ask Can you fix the AC please? It is like we are asking her for her first newborn. Darina(one of the front desk workers) was the only person that felt sorry for us, sadly it was when we were leaving which we were glad to do and we further cancelled our next reservation for the next week.It was very dingy and dark. Great location is the only plus

Reviews.Title: “What a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: beauty8
Reviews.Content: This hotel misslead customers from the begining, what they showed in their website is way different that what theeir hotel looks like. We booked the room 2 months in advance, when we arrieved to Rome the air conditioner was not working, we called the front desk they stated that it was a holiday and the personal to fix the a/c will be back the next morning. We spend the night with no a/c,the next day we left in the am with the promise that our a/c will be fixed, wrong again, needless to say we spend 3 nights in the hotel with no a/c and nobody to talk about our frustration. Bad staff service and manners , did not wanted to talk to us. I will never use this hotel ever ever ever.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Hotel disguised as 4-Star Comes with Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Arkybergy
Reviews.Content: Am not sure how this could be called a four-Star Hotel. But, as a Three-Star, the property has its pros and cons. The BEST feature is LOCATION. The hotel is located a short few blocks from St.Peter's square on a major thoroughfare and adjacent to a bustling square with all sorts of transportation options. Accessibility is the best feature. The down side are the amenities. The rooms are dimly lit, dingy and noisy. Our two windows were narrow slits of light, akin to a correctional facility. The hotel definitely tries to market its edginess with the rampant "ALL things Orange" decorating campaign as well as the quirky metro-chic furniture and accessories. The target audience is early 20-somethings. On the other hand, the bathroom was better than average with updated and attractive features including a whirlpool tub. Air Conditioning was excellent (perhaps the narrow windows retained the cold air). Internet is not free but the charge is minimal. However, we couldn't get wireless in our room and couldn't even access from our Mac once we found the hotel network in the lobby. The front desk person couldn't help, looking like a deer in the headlights. My request for postcard stamps was met by the same blank stare with no suggestions where I could purchase any outside the hotel. (My hunch is that postcards are edging toward obscurity if her 20-something reaction is any indication.) I felt I was asking for a rotary telephone or a manual typewriter. Breakfast is okay but not 4-star quality. The breakfast attendant was very sweet and accommodating as was one of the front desk staff who generously made dinner reservations and offered a great restaurant suggestion. Spotty at best and recommended as a THREE-Star. However, as long as the price rivals 4-Star properties, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Trav_123Perth
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. All looks good from the outside and location is very good, but it needs immediate maintenance and serious staff retraining regarding that simple concept of "customer service". I stayed here for 6 nights and felt like I was extracting teeth to get any help. My room was supposed to have pay TV and that did not work. I made reception aware of this on a daily basis and nothing was done. Then the TV packed up entirely mid way thru my stay and once again staff did not want to do anything about it......all was to hard. Then the door handle broke....like actually come right off the door.....once again I reported it and got that famous shrug of the shoulders response which was becoming the norm in this place. At one stage they asked me to see management about this issue with items not working and more importantly nothing was being done to repair them. My response to this person was would you like me to do your job for you? I saw no reason why I had to see management about something that I believe is a hotels responsibility not mine. I stayed at the "low budget" Easy hotel in London previous to this and they felt like a real hotel as all the basics were met unlike this hotel where everything was just to hard. I believe my requests were not over the top and well within what is fair and reasonable regarding an expected service. This Hotel fell seriously short of that.....it's not about the TV or the door handle, it's simply how they failed in trying to help there customer. For the record TV and Door handle were still broken when I left.

Reviews.Title: “It was not the best option!”
Reviews.Author: kerri_10
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms but not in the centre of Rome!It was a small hotel,with generous staff! I think that it is a bit expensive!!!The bathroom was not comfortable at all!

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY NOT A FOUR STAR”
Reviews.Author: simplyredEastbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel description was a 4 star design chic hotel. We definitely would not give this hotel a 4 star rating. Our room was small but acceptable for Rome. The TV only screened italian stations. Satalite was charged at 10 euros per day. The reception staff were always approachable, pleasant and able to give relevant information. The breakfast choice was very very limited served between 7.30 and 10.00. We arrived before 9.30 on three consequetive mornings, (2 of which they ran out of bread which was unreplenishable). We always had to ask for cutlery which was provided. Everything was cleared away by 9.55 before crockery from guest tables were cleared, thus giving the impression they were keen to finish. This hotel is trying hard to be eco/environment friendly in many aspects but basics in service are obsolete. We would definitely not return or recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: JonandMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in this hotel and it was great. Nice staff and good service for a nice price. The location is about 300 meters from both st. peters and the vatican museum. It took only 30 minutes by taxi to get there from fiumicno airport. Busstop is very close so if you need to go elsewhere it's very easy. For instance the bus to pantheon/trevi-fountain stops right infront of the hotel across the street. It takes about a 20 minute walk to get to piazza navona. Breakfast is simpel, toast, croissants, jus d'orange and ofcourse superb cappucino. If you want to visit st. peters be sure to be there at 8.30 a.m. to avoid the crowd. There are also many shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the Vatican, this small, stylish, affordable hotel fits the bill”
Reviews.Author: Hipoteca
Reviews.Content: We got to Rome 24 hours after expected because of an airline mishap. The hotel changed our reservation obligingly and didn't charge us for the missed night. An easy walk the subway we arrived at the hotel grateful for the air conditioning and clean, stylish accommodation. While the rooms are on the small side, this is Rome for a reasonable rate so going in with the right attitude will not disappoint. Front desk staff were young, knowledgeable and friendly. One staffer recommended a restaurant we will remember always. The roof top patio is not to be missed!!! Bathrooms North American size and clean. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Raffasworld
Reviews.Content: Pros: locations is awesome, 5 minutes walking from subway and easy access to S.Peter Basilica and Castel S.Angelo. the hotel looks recently renewed, good size rooms and calm. front desk very helpful and kind. Quality/price is really worthed in Rome. Beautiful view from the rooftop where it's possible to have a breakfast. Cons: breakfast is not the best, comparing with other hotel in Rome. Poor choices and service slow and unprofessional. internet wireless connection very slow and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Too much orange!”
Reviews.Author: Phili22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in september and didnt really enjoy our experience. The staff were friendly, which was nice, but everything else was disappointing. I knew the place was called Hotel Orange, but i didnt realise that everything was literally going to be Orange coloured and scented. It was just a bit much for us. The elevator smells like orange cleaning products, the bathroom has orange lighting, the hand/body wash is orange, the shower is orange, the room smells like orange ect ect ect... The room itself was very small, which is standard for Rome, but it was also very dark and depressing. You had to have all the lights on in the morning to see what you were doing! The location was good though, very close to the vatican and away from the hussle and bussle. I wouldnt stay here again... think you can do better in Rome for the money we payed.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: XEuroTraveler
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here twice during our trip. We arrived in Rome, spent 3 days showing the family around before we went up to Tuscany for a week in a villa. When we came back to Rome we spent another 4 nights here finishing up our trip. The roof top restaurant area was a great place to hang out, and we had dinner a few nights there when we just didn't feel like heading out again after busy days. The lady who prepared breakfast was very friendly and she always had a smile on her face. The guys at the restaurant during dinner were also very friendly and very accommodating, and they gave us some excellent suggestions for restaurants in the area. The location was great, just blocks from the Vatican that you can see from the roof top. The metro station is just blocks away as well and you can get and from everything you would want to do from this hotel very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality !! It's like our home in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Y05
Reviews.Content: We have stayed Orange hotel several times (more than 5 times in about 2 years) and always received the best hospitality from all of their staffs. Staffs are so kind and when we visit them, always welcome us like a family.

Reviews.Title: “'Natural Cheap'”
Reviews.Author: xksb
Reviews.Content: The first room we were assigned to smelled like cat pee (as reiterated by housekeeping) and the layout (luxury deluxe with jacuzzi bath) was not the one I booked online. After much disappointment upon checking in 10.30pm, the reception said they would put us in another room (junior suite) for the night and see how to accommodate us tomorrow morning. To my surprise, we were awoken by a phone call from the morning shift saying, first off, that we need to pay extra for last night's stay in junior suite. Over my dead body! We were moved to another room, which they claim is a luxury deluxe, but it's so tiny and still without the jacuzzi bath I booked. The room was dirty; I did not want to walk bare foot around the room for the entire 5 nights I was there for. The bathroom is tiny and not functional (there's room in a corner that's not being utilized). The air conditioning, when swtiched on, has this strange smell. But, it was so hot, we had to turn it on. After 5 long nights, we were pleased to get out of there, but not without dragging our heavy suitcases down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and stone's throw from Vatican”
Reviews.Author: mhnmiami
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful with recommending local restaurants and providing information. Room was comfortable. Location was excellent for visiting the vatican, and a reasonable walk for other locations. For the price, the hotel was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: LuisRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: We are from Brazil and we have just stayed there for 5 days: Excellent Hotel ! Very next to Vatican, Vatican Museum and 400 m to a metro-station ( Ottaviano ) , allowing access to all parts of Rome. The room and bathroom are very clean and modernized in orange and black colors, the staff is extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast is nice and may be had at the hotel roof, facing Vatican cupola. We would recommend it to everyone. And the price is very affordable, too : 100 Euros/ day at the time. Excellent choice !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a fantastic place to visit Vatican”
Reviews.Author: J_GBunschoten
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 days and had the luck that all standard rooms where full and we got the junior suite. It was a big nice room on the front side of Hotel on first floor. This is the only negativ point of the hotel. The rooms or badly noise insulated (single glas windows) and there is a lot of traffic on the road so till deep in the night the rooms are very noisy. Further I have to say that we were very satisfied about the hotel and its personel. The breakfast is basic but for Italian standards quite good only quality of the food is below level (cheap orange juice, ham and cheese). However we have to be aware that price is also very attravtiv and therefor real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Funky design, looking slightly tired; Staff helpful when asked”
Reviews.Author: kevmitch
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, very little storage space, everything colour coded. Breakfast adequate, not huge. Staff responsive when asked, but not openly helpful in the main. Roof top restaurant and terrace very pleasant. Relatively good value for money given location 2 mins fron Vatican. good shopping nearby, metro 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay again at Orange Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendy9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Hotel 28 Sept for 4 nights. We were a group of 5 adults needing a double room and a triple room. Like most city centre hotels the rooms were not overly large, but functional. Our double room had a corner jacuzzi bath rather than a shower, but it was fine. The triple room had a double bed, and a small single bed which was acceptable. Proper bath and shower in this room. I had read a few negative comments on Tripadvisor about this hotel and chose it mainly for the location just a few minutes walk from the Vatican. Cost was reasonable for a major city. For some reason the receptionist could not explain American passport holders get a special rate if they pay in cash on arrival. This suited the three American members of our group who got their triple room slightly cheaper than our double. One thing I did not like about the rooms was the carpets, which appeared a little grubby. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace, which is a great way to start the day. The lady there is very friendly and helpful. One issue I raised was that the buffet ran out of some things quite early. I saw some people taking food away, which guests should be clearly told is not allowed. Overall I think Orange Hotel has more plus points than negative and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and dirty, with unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LordBarrington
Reviews.Content: Looks great in photo's, but the reality is completely worn out. The room was of a good size, but was dirty and very smelly. We complained as soon as we checked in, but as that was 4pm in the afternoon, no one did anything about it. I took the manager to the room the next day, and she shrugged her shoulders, (what a joke this woman is). There is no double glazing, so the road noise is incredibly loud. Do not go hear if you are hoping to sleep at all. I went to the bar for some ice, at 9pm, and was told they had run out, (this was after standing in the bar for 10 minutes, asking all the staff i could see). I ended up going down the street to a bar, and buying some ice, (could they not have offered to do that?). The following night, I order some more ice through room service. The ice they could provide, but unbelievably, they were unable to supply even 1 glass. Its completely rubbish this place, a massive waste of time and money. They offered a discount when we next come.................i asked them "why would i ever stay in such a dirty hotel ever again". Its not cheap, its not cheerful, its a disgrace!

Reviews.Title: “It's a glorified dorm with snotty staff”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. I reserved a rate on the internet that was for no EU people only that when we checked in we were told that we had to pay in cash even though under the PAYMENT terms on my confirmation it did not say that anywhere. Long story short the staff on check out was snotty and used the excuse of "pay with cash or pay a higher rate (about 80 Euro a night higher) to be able to use our credit card". No where on the confirmation did it say that. The rooms are glorified dorm rooms. The walls are a drab gray. The windows let in almost no light. The Sky TV is really spotty to the point that just leaving the TV off is a better option. The beds are very hard and the top comforter had what looked like a blood stain near the bottom on it. The bathroom is tiny, which is fine, but there was NO counter space and the shower is super small (think coat closet small). The location is OK if you're only going to the Vatican but I would not say to stay here if you're going to spend the majority of your time in the central core. Basically I would never go back. And I hate the "pay cash, you're American" crap.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: yeewah
Reviews.Content: A very cool little gem in Rome near the Vatican and the metro. Friendly staff and a delightful restaurant on the top floor serving beautiful modern Italian cuisine. Highly recommended and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: AplusK
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides all the basic comforts. Rooms are reasonably sized, with a large bathroom (loved the big shower head) and hair dryer. They include refrigerator, safe-box and satellite TV. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and really go out of their way to please. Breakfast is served on the top floor and weather permitting you can sit outside with a view to the Vatican and Rome's rooftops. The breakfast is standard (no eggs). The top floor restaurant has a new management. Can't comment on the food. The only really negative point is the access to the lift. If you have heavy luggage you need to negotiate a number of steps leading to the reception. All in all an excellent choice. I selected this hotel because of its proximity to the Vatican. Walking time to St. Peter square is about 5 minutes. Tram, Metro and buses are available nearby and the hotel will call a taxi if required. By the way if you intend to do a hop-on hop-off bus tour do NOT take the 110bus.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic stay in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: BTELO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my 7 year old son. Staff was great in helping us arrange car service to and from the airport. It is in a great location and you could see the Vatican wall once you walk out from the hotel. You can take Tram 19 one stop to the Metro. The rooms were clean, and the air conditioning absolutely fantastic... cooled the room down in 5 minutes, and that is important in August when temperatures reached 35 degrees celcius or more. Great location and can walk to all the sites. All the staff were great, and I would definitely recommend to friends and come back to stay. Modern decor is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about it!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy-girl123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in April after reading the reviews on Trip advisor. We really were delighted with it. The location was fantastic we could walk to everything! the hotel was fabulous, the modern theme was very well thogt out. Out of all the restaurants in Rome I don't think an of them compaed to the food in the rooftop restaurant- absolutely gorgeous! the staff were brilliant also- they really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The rooms were nice, air conditioning, bathrooms modern with large shower. Sattelite TV, music....I would definitely like to come back here in the future. I think we got a really good deal as well especially considering the location. I don't know what else to say except: GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “Fine for students”
Reviews.Author: kittengn
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for the Vatican. We never even saw a que when we went because we were so nearby. The area isn't the most inspiring other than that though, although Rome doesn't do winter very well and I imagine its a lot more vibrant in the warmer months. The hotel is a but like a modernised hostel and I found it disappointing. The room was fine although not exactly user friendly with awkward corners and a genuine case of design over content. We had a problem in the middle of the night when our bathroom door looked itself! There was nowhere to put anything and it was very dark. The breakfast is a bit odd and the communal areas a bit cold. All in all if we were 20 it would have been perfect but in hindsight not the best option for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, for young couples or friends”
Reviews.Author: Nenah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few nights of our honeymoon. We thought the location was excellent and we walked everywhere during the day and sometimes got taxis to further away locations by night. There is a really cool bar/ bistro on the street opposite and over. The guy on reception was really helpful and pleasant. The girls in the rooftop area were rude and unfriendly. The food was hideously bad, even the coffee!!! Still, they only serve breakfast so we only made the mistake of going there once. It's a shame there isn't a bar up there cause it would have been nice to relax there for a while during the day or evening. The room was very clean and funky but small. Still it was ideal for us as we weren't interested in stayin in our room all the time. I would highly recommend this hotel but to young people reallly - hope I don't offend but with small rooms and no dining facilities I think it mightn't suit the older traveller.

Reviews.Title: “All we were expecting and more!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki0307
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my daughter and me as it was located so closely to St Peter's. Were a little apprehensive regarding the negative comments viewed on here but, decided that the location and price couldn't be beaten. It was absolutely delightful. The staff could not have been more helpful, courteous and absolutely willing to do all they could to make our stay an enjoyable one. There were signs of damage to the bath panel and pedal bin in the bathroom. However, this just highlights the lack of care some guests show to their surroundings and must be a cause of frustration to the management of the hotel having gone to such lengths to provide excellent, value to money facilities. Am also at a loss as to understand the criticism regarding the breakfast. It was more than ample and served in a beautiful rooftop setting by a lovely lady who was always so attentive. First class break and will have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOLIDAY EVER!! This hotel should be a higher star rating.”
Reviews.Author: MongFish
Reviews.Content: Me and my Girlfriend arrived at the hotel in the evening and the book-in was quick and easy and the lift meant that we didnt have to lug our bags up the flights of stairs. We had help every time we needed it and bonded with the staff almost straight away especially both the receptionist, who talked to us about Rome/Italy and the things to do, and the waiter/manager of the restaurant on the top floor, who told us information about the Pantheon and other places and where to get the best coffee in Rome! The restaurant was a tad pricey but worth it as the food was really really good! Also an absolutely fantastic thing that the manager did was (as it was my girfriends birthday and valentines day two days before) to buy a chocolate cake laced with ameretto and a bunch of roses in a vase on request via email to the manager from me. The manager emailed me all the information I needed about the holiday. The beautiful rooms are very chic as the hotel website explains, we stayed in room 308 (junior suite) this was fantastic with great views of the main street and a bath in the bedroom (I know it sounds wierd but it is definately a highlight!). you are hit with a faint orange aroma as you walk in and the bathroom also has this fresh scent. The rooms are cleaned thouroughly everyday and our bed clothes were folded neatly for when we came back from a great day out. There is a safe, tv with sky, a mini fridge and electric window shutters operated with a button by the bed to reduce the amount of movement you have to make :). The shower in the bathroom is very good! The vatican is literally across a square outside, but the hotel is conveniantly just tucked within a main street so the tourist don't pile down your road just normal everyday traffic. the main city centre is a bit of a walk but when you are sightseeing and talking you really don't notice. We walked to the other side of Rome to the Trevi Fountain (Which, by the way, is very romantic!!) and that didnt take too long and my Girlfriend certainly isn't a hiker and she didnt complain! (scooters or bikes are available on request but we did'nt bother) The metro is a bit of a walk up a high street across the square outside the hotel (not too far) and this is how we got to the Colloseum for just 1 euro each way! We went to few restaurants around Rome during our week and the food is delicious especially pizza! Rome is the place to be! For everybody, and it is such a beautiful place with the magnificent buildings and the culture is amazing! The people are also very friendly! Would recommend this place to anyone, and we are planning a return trip...

Reviews.Title: “Electric Orange!”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: Our family tradition is to avoid spending family holidays with family. My husband and I traveled to the Orange Hotel in Rome to take advantage of their heavy Euro special and an affordable flight. This hotel has so many positives that I may run out of room. Our room, 308 (the junior suite) was excellently appointed. The plastic white, back-lit bathtub was cool. Take your fizzy bath bombs! The room was thoughtfully designed, with motion sensor lights in the closets, a toilet and bedet, effective black out shades and extra pillows. The breakfast is decent. We ate dinner in the restaurant, which officially opened after our trip. The owner was delightful, and the food was good after a long day of walking. I also liked that this hotel touts itself as a green hotel that actually seems to be. If you hang your used towels up, they do not take them and wash them anyway. When we put ours on the floor, they took them as promised. The staff downstairs was extremely helpful and accomodating, and the location could not be better. We were steps from the Vatican and a short walk from many of Rome's other attractions. Because this is a more residential area, there are many great markets to buy snacks for the room, like salami and cheese, and the in-room fridge has extra space. Some pointers if you visit. This is a budget hotel. They do not provide toiletries other than pump soap. Take your own toiletries. They do not provide wireless internet, but a terminal is available in the lobby for 2 euro for 30 minutes. The hotel is on a busy street and is noisy, but my lime green earplugs (provided) blocked it all out. There is no radio in the room or any other means by which to play music. Take your own travel IPod adaptor and travel speakers or other means of generating music if you must have it. It is 40 euro to the airport by taxi, but we took the subway and commuter rail for 24 euro. A subway stop is only a couple of blocks away. I would absolutely stay in this hotel again. It is excellently priced, clean and well located. I commend them. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielo74
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Orange in Rome and it was great!. The location is perfect and the neighbourhood it's very nice. The staff was very friendly and heplful. Two nights we decided to dinner at the hotel bar, the food and the wine was great!. Of all the hotels we stayed in Italy, this one was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: ShootingGirl
Reviews.Content: So many problems, so little time. The most egregious was on the last day: my husband stayed back and read a book in the lounge while my sister & I went sightseeing. He asked the desk lady (Spider-Lady based on the spider web tattoo on her arm) for the nearest restroom. She sent him to the basement which required going up 15 steps, then down ~30 steps to the maid's WC, which he had to re-trace to the lounge, not knowing that in the lounge where he was reading THERE WAS A BATHROOM! Did I mention that he uses a can due to recent knee surgery? And he has a bladder disorder that makes him use the facilities almost hourly? And, yes, she WAS aware of these conditions. Unconscionable! She had an attitude on every shift we had to interact with her. The other ladies were OK, but I got the feeling that asking any question was an imposition. Second was the music pounding Wednesday night. Even with ear plugs, I had a hard time going to sleep. Fortunately, it stopped a little after midnight. Hotel was decorated for looks but not function. No towel hooks - where do you hang the hand towel after washing your face? No counter space for make-up bag. Only liquid soap in a dispenser, not sure if it was shampoo in the shower or soap, either way one was missing. At breakfast I was told I could only have 1 cup of coffee, after that I had to pay! We'll NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....poor breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: ZagrebTraveler1982
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for four nights this April in Orange hotel and we liked it except few things. The room we got was too small, a bit claustrophobic, and we asked if they had a bigger one. They offered us to have one room for two nights and then the other one for the other two nights. As that was too inconvenient for us, we decided to stay in the given room. Two girls working on the front desk were very polite and hospitable the whole duration of our stay. The bathroom was actually the bright point; with a Jacuzzi bath and a romantic orange light….very clean, towels changed every day…The very bad point of this hotel (however, of most hotels in Italy, as we stayed in a hotel in Siena couple of days later) is the breakfast. Italy definitely deserves a better breakfast! The hotel also has a garage (as we arrived in Rome by car) which is tiny and it is quite rough to get out if you have a bigger car. However, it is great to have it parked on the safe place, and they charge 20euro per day, and around the hotel it’s 1euro per hour…so it’s worth it….. All in all, this hotel has a great location and is a perfect place for those who come to Rome to explore and to walk a lot as it’s situated exactly between the city center and Vatican City. Though some might find it costly…

Reviews.Title: “amazing decorated hotel... just a few issues”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with a group of 20 other people, when we entered the lobby it was very nicely decorated and in english! I was surprised to notice there were only 3 floors of rooms, i thought the hotel would be a little bigger. We stayed on the 3rd floor of the hotel in a triple occupancy room, it was alittle cramped, but the bathroom was actually bigger than i expected. Everything worked in our room except the television, other people had time to use the television and were able to get english television channels using the skytv. The windows were huge and we were unsure how to make the blind go down, we went to the lobby and the guy working was helpful, he was unsure how to put it down exactly, but came up to the room to check it out and he did figure it out. The lights only stay on with the key card in, which was a little annoying. My complaints for this hotel would be; bad food, breakfast was the only food we got and other than that there was no food around so i suggest you stock up on food in your room incase you get hungry! It is a noisy because of the location, you can hear cars and anyone talking near your room. Other than that the staff did a good job keeping the rooms clean and the location is extremely close to the vatican. There is a great pizza place around the block to, best pizza i had in italy! Overall i would recommend people to go to this hotel if they plan on doing alot of touring through the day and don't rely on hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonros
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the room that we booked on-line because it was not available anymore. The room was very small, dark and almost claustrophobic. Bathroom was very small and without windows. Breakfast was not exceptional and you have to pay if you get a second coffee! Rates are too high compared to the overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “stylish one in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bistvan
Reviews.Content: just get back from the orange hotel. well, the hotel is in a perfect location (as my tagline sez). close to an underground staion (i think it's "ottaviano") and really close to the vatican. as far as i felt, it was an "ok" or a bit worse hotel some time ago. someone bought it and did his/her best to make a so called "design hotel". well, this peson was quite successfull. yes, it's orange. see orange, smell orange or even eat orange (there are some small orange trees on the roof terrace). i liked it. the staff was really helpful and kind. we arrived quite early, but our rooms were ready. but, there are some negative things, too. the basic idea of "orange" was good, but there are some points where the execution is poor. it's like "i wanna be a design hotel, but at the end of the day i'm not". basically, no probs at all, i just felt like i said. the breakfast could be better and more. anyway, it's a really good hotel in a reasonable price (compare to the same quality hotels in rome).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a location near The vatican”
Reviews.Author: jcgso
Reviews.Content: Orange Hotel is a new hotel located near the Vatican and Castel San Angelo. Room was small, but very clean, with good bathroom, mini bar, TV and safe. Some street noise, but not bad. Breakfast was not the best, but OK. They do charge for coffee after your first cup. The staff spoke English and were extremely helpful and friendly. The rates were very good for the area. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent modern hotel well located. Just needs to iron out a few problems!”
Reviews.Author: tappy2005
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from the Orange Hotel and thought I'd write a review as there are very few for it. The hotel is very well located. It's a 2 minute walk from the Vatican and about 5 minutes from a ottaviano metro station. From the metro it's only 5 minutes to most of the other major sites. The hotel seems brand new, I'd guess it's only been open for a couple of months. They've gone for a very modern look. Everything is sleek, the colour scheme is white, grey with highlights of orange. It almost feels like a boutique hotel but falls short on that front. During our stay, the hotel seemed very quiet, we only saw 3 other guests. I stayed in a normal room (they have double rooms and suites). The size was ok, maybe a bit on the small side. It is nicely decorated, the bed is nice and has a very large (faux?) leather headboard. The room has air conditioning (the type that sits below the window) and it is remote controlled). There is a nice small LCD TV that has Italian Sky TV. Most channels are Italian but there are English ones. Some of the channels are multi-lingual, if you click the 'i' button you can change the language. The room has a small mini-bar, the prices were reasonable. If you look at my photos I've included the price list. The walls in the room are canvas material. This really helps with the soundproofing. I didn't hear a noise from any other guests whilst I was there. Though unfortunately I did hear alot of noise from the traffic. I stayed in room 103 on the first floor, even thought it doesn''t face onto the road the traffic noise was very annoying. Shutting the blind help but we only figured out how to do this on our last day! (there's a button next to the bed). The bathroom is small but nice. There is a bidet which is always a bonus. The shampoo/hand cream is orange scented which was a nice touch. Our room had a bath with a shower overhead. The bath has glass sliding doors which kept the bathroom nice and dry. Our rate included breakfast which is served on the top floor between 7:30 and 10:00. The was very good, there were cakes, cereal, yoghurts, croissants, toast etc... The coffee was also nice (they'll make many varieties using a proper coffee machine). The breakfast room is pretty small though and only has a few tables, this wasn't a problem as there were so few guests staying in the hotel. In the summer I think they put extra tables on the room patio. The views from the breakfast room are very good. You can see over the rooftops and the dome of St. Peters. The hotel apparently offers wireless internet but I failed to pick up the signal for it. There is an internet station downstairs but I didn't use it. The staff all seemed nice enough, they spoke English well and upon request recommended a nice Pizzeria in the city. One thing that did concern me is that there is no luggage room. For a modern hotel this seems stupid. When we checked out we had to leave our bags behind the computer desk. This was open for anyone to take. I didn't like this but had no other choice. The bags were always in sight of the receptionist but I'd much prefer them to be locked in a room. Nothing was taken. One other problem with this hotel is the lack of literature. There is nothing to tell you about the hotel. There was no 'do not disturb' sign, no information on how to use the pay movies. No information on the services. I could find no mention of the breakfast room and it's location. In the room there was a strange small flashing green light next to the door. If you pushed the button on the panel it would change to orange. Push it again and it went to red. Push it again and it'd go off. I have no idea whatsoever what this was for! Also it's not obvious that the blind is electrical. It's only by randomly pushing a button that I figured it out. All in all I liked the hotel I paid €78 a night which is a good price. The other hotels in this price band were all located near the Termini. I'd advise against booking a hotel there as it seemed a dodgy area. Many unsavoury looking people seem to hang around the streets near the Termin at night. If they could make a luggage room, and sort out a little book with useful information it would make a big difference. I would stay at the hotel again. Forgive the quality of some of the photos, my camera isn't the best! I just tried to post as many as I could because there are currently no photos of the hotel on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: AmiGermany
Reviews.Content: We had awful service while we stayed in December 07. We did not know how to get from the hotel to the airport, and the front desk "girl"...there was not a person that worked at the desk the four days we stayed there older than 25.,,,said that we should just check the internet ourselves. I told her that I would think that a hotel would know exactly how to get to the airport considering it's a hotel in one of the biggest cities in the world. She then told me to just look it up myself and that she couldn't help me. Then you have to pay 2 euros for 30 minutes of internet use, 3 euros for one hour, and 10 euros for 24 hours. The problem with that was that it was NEVER advertised liked that on their website. Also, the room to eat breakfast in was tiny, and the girl that works there doesn't speak English and my wife was only allowed one coffee per breakfast. It was very crowded and there was nowhere to sit. However, saying all that the rooms were very clean, and the flat screen tv and sky was a bonus. The location is also great right by the metro and the vatican. The service has a LOT to be desired and people working there just didn't seem like they knew what they were doing. But, if this was improved we would have had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomh21
Reviews.Content: This location of this hotel is great really close to Vatican and within walking distance of main tourist sites. The hotel is really funky and looks great, room was good size with lovely bathroom sky tv flatscreen tv etc. Breakfast was a small contintental buffett which was nice. Staff were pleasant apart from breakfast staff on last day - don't think they liked the fact we arrived at 0945 and it finished at 1000. Down sides were no hotel bar (although it may be different in summer - not sure) and also did not offer iron/ironing board (although this was also case in other Italy hotel) and also did not have a international adaptor we could borrow. The hotel looks good and location is good, if facailities on offer were better would definately be a wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great shopping around the bend”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler4
Reviews.Content: I happened to run into the Orange hotel by accident--I was staying at another hotel half a block away and was not happy with this selection. Once I saw the Orange hotel, I checked out of my original hotel and was so happy I did! The staff was absolutely delightful, the room was comfortable with all needed amenities (comfy bed, great shower, Sky TV). The breakfast served on the rooftop was perfect, cappuccino and croissants and fresh juices were quite enjoyable...The hotel is within walking distance of the Vatican and around the corner from some of the best shopping and restaurants available in Rome and the metro is a comfortable 5 minute walk away--yet it is removed from the throngs of tourists in central Rome. Overall, the Orange hotel is a stylish, chic establishment that deserves many accolades.
